page.title: 13ALL SAINTS CHURCH-Newchurch1
page.content: This lovely old church was originally built by William Fitz Osborne in the 11th Century. The name "New Church" tells of days when the small pre-conquest church was rebuilt in {NORMAN times.} The church has been enlarged twice, once in the 12th century and once in the 13th century. The All Saints Church is different from most of the other churches on the Isle of Wight. It's{TOWER}is on the south side. It should be on the west side. It is on the south side because on the west side there is a very, very steep shute and by now thetower would have crumbled away. The church is even more strange because the top part of the tower is weather boarded. Just inside the door are a few ropes which are used to ring{ BELLS}at the top of the tower.
